_meta.description: Seasonal weather guides for cruise ports. Tier 1 = hand-curated, Tier 2 = template + edits, Tier 3 = regional defaults

at_a_glance.rain: Brief afternoon showers common; heaviest Jun-Oct
at_a_glance.wind: Trade winds provide relief; strongest Dec-Apr

catches_off_guard: Afternoon squalls can appear suddenly — rain is brief but intense
Humidity makes 85°F feel much hotter; pace yourself
Trade winds can create chop on the east side for snorkeling
Sun is intense even on cloudy days — reef-safe sunscreen essential
September has highest hurricane risk; ships may divert
packing_nudges: Reef-safe sunscreen (required by law for snorkeling)
Light rain jacket or poncho for afternoon showers
Water shoes for rocky beach entries
Breathable clothing — cotton wilts in humidity
Insect repellent for ruins and jungle areas

hazards.note: Ships may reroute during active storms; travel insurance recommended
